content: a needle size to make the sock bigger or smaller length of foot is adjustable according to the foot length you are knitting the sock for gauge for colourwork section small 2 25mm us 1 needles 38sts x 40 rounds 10cm 4 inches medium 2 5mm us 1 5 needles 36sts x 38 rounds 10cm 4 inches large 2 75mm us 2 needles 34sts x 36 rounds 10cm 4 inches colourwork when knitting stranded colourwork be consistent with how you hold the yarns the yarn used to knit the contrast pattern should always cross below the yarn knit for the background colour at the back of your work be sure to knit the floats loosely ends tip it is possible to knit these socks without cutting the ends and instead carrying the yarn up through the sock using them whenever the colour is repeated rather than having lots of ends to sew in at the end be warned however this can result in the 5 balls of yarn getting tangled if you transport your sock project around abbreviations k= knit p= purl st s = stitch es k2tog= knit 2 stitches together sl1 = slip one stitch purlwise from the left hand needle to the right hand needle ssk= slip one stitch knitwise slip next stitch knitwise knit slipped stitches together p2tog= purl 2 stitches together m1l= make 1 left pick up the bar between the stitch you knit and the one you are about to knit bringing the needle from the front to the back then knit in to the back of the stitch making a new stitch m1k= m1 stitch in the stitch under the k2tog stitch see diagrams a and knit the picked up stitch m1p= m1 stitch in the stitch under the p2tog stitch see diagrams b and purl the picked up stitch rs= right side ws= wrong side bor= beginning of the round 2 pattern copyright charlotte stone stoneknits 2019 for personal use only the colour sequence for the sock will be written as c1 purple c2 yellow c3 dark pink c4 orange c5 light pink there is a colour work chart on page 6 which can be used for you to colour in with the colours you have chosen if you are not knitting with the colours shown in the sample instructions cuff cast on 60 64 68 sts with cc1 divide sts evenly over 2 circular needles 30 32 34 sts on each needle now place a marker at the beginning of the round be careful when joining in the round not to twist your stitches knit ribbing k2 p2 for a total of 10 row leg with cc1 knit the increase round - small size only *k7 m1l* 8 times then k4 8sts increased 68sts total - medium size only *k8 m1l* repeat until the end of the round 8sts increased 72sts total - large size only *k9 m1l k8 m1l* repeat to end 8sts increased 76sts total all sizes start
